Summary statistics serve to summarize of the location and spread of a distribution.

Consider the following distribution of (simulated) mammalian body size data

```{r echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
mammalmass <- rlnorm(999, meanlog = 2.6)
bmplot <- qplot(mammalmass, xlab="Body Mass (kg)") + theme_bw(20)
```

## Location

```{r}
bmplot + 
  geom_vline(xintercept = mean(mammalmass), color = "red", linetype = "dotdash") + 
  geom_vline(xintercept = sort(mammalmass)[500], color = "blue", linetype="dotted") + 
  geom_vline(xintercept = sort(mammalmass)[500], color = "blue", linetype="dotted") 
```
